message.content:
OK, have just done the first test of file uploading since adding upload event logging, and I notice that the blue dots are not being updated in real tiem.  Each time that a file starts to upload, it's dot should be changed to yellow dot ðŸŸ¡.  Each time that a file upload completes successfully, we should update the file to have a green dotðŸŸ¢ (this should happen at the same time that we increment the successful upload chip).  Each time that a file uploads fails, we should update it's dot to red ðŸ”´\
\

file.content:
<template>
  <v-container fluid class="main-viewport">
    <!-- Main Upload Area -->
    <UploadDropzone
      v-if="uploadQueue.length === 0"
      ref="dropzoneRef"
      :is-drag-over="isDragOver"
      @drag-over="handleDragOver"
      @drag-leave="handleDragLeave"
      @drop="handleDrop"
      @trigger-file-select="triggerFileSelectWrapper"
      @trigger-folder-select="triggerFolderSelectWrapper"
      @file-select="handleFileSelect"
      @folder-select="handleFolderSelect"
    />

    <!-- Folder Options Dialog -->
    <FolderOptionsDialog
      :show="showFolderOptions"
      :subfolder-count="subfolderCount"
      :include-subfolders="includeSubfolders"
      :is-analyzing="isAnalyzing"
      :main-folder-analysis="mainFolderAnalysis"
      :all-files-analysis="allFilesAnalysis"
      :main-folder-progress="mainFolderProgress"
      :all-files-progress="allFilesProgress"
      :main-folder-complete="mainFolderComplete"
      :all-files-complete="allFilesComplete"
      :is-analyzing-main-folder="isAnalyzingMainFolder"
      :is-analyzing-all-files="isAnalyzingAllFiles"
      :analysis-timed-out="analysisTimedOut"
      :timeout-error="timeoutError"
      :current-progress-message="currentProgressMessage"
      :total-directory-entry-count="totalDirectoryEntryCount"
      @update:show="showFolderOptions = $event"
      @update:include-subfolders="includeSubfolders = $event"
      @confirm="confirmFolderOptions"
      @cancel="cancelFolderUpload"
    />

    <!-- Upload Queue/Preview -->
    <FileUploadQueue
      v-if="uploadQueue.length > 0 || isProcessingUIUpdate"
      class="flex-grow-1"
      :files="uploadQueue"
      :is-processing-ui-update="isProcessingUIUpdate"
      :ui-update-progress="uiUpdateProgress"
      :total-analyzed-files="totalAnalyzedFiles"
      :upload-status="uploadStatus"
      :show-time-progress="
        timeWarning.startTime.value !== null && (uploadQueue.length === 0 || isProcessingUIUpdate)
      "
      :time-progress="{
        elapsedTime: timeWarning.elapsedTime.value,
        progressPercentage: timeWarning.progressPercentage.value,
        isOverdue: timeWarning.isOverdue.value,
        overdueSeconds: timeWarning.overdueSeconds.value,
        timeRemaining: timeWarning.timeRemaining.value,
        formattedElapsedTime: timeWarning.formattedElapsedTime.value,
        formattedTimeRemaining: timeWarning.formattedTimeRemaining.value,
        estimatedDuration: timeWarning.estimatedDuration.value,
      }"
      :is-uploading="uploadStatus.isUploading"
      :is-paused="uploadStatus.isPaused"
      :is-starting-upload="isStartingUpload"
      @remove-file="removeFromQueue"
      @start-upload="handleStartUpload"
      @pause-upload="handlePauseUpload"
      @resume-upload="handleResumeUpload"
      @clear-queue="clearQueue"
    />

    <!-- Single File Upload Notification -->
    <v-snackbar
      v-model="showSingleFileNotification"
      :timeout="3000"
      :color="singleFileNotification.color"
      location="top"
    >
      {{ singleFileNotification.message }}
      <template #actions>
        <v-btn color="white" variant="text" @click="showSingleFileNotification = false">
          Close
        </v-btn>
      </template>
    </v-snackbar>

    <!-- Processing Progress Modal -->
    <ProcessingProgressModal
      v-model="processingProgress.isProcessing"
      :progress="processingProgress"
      :can-cancel="true"
      @cancel="handleCancelProcessing"
    />

    <!-- Cloud File Warning Modal -->
    <CloudFileWarningModal
      :is-visible="timeWarning.showCloudFileWarning.value"
      :formatted-elapsed-time="timeWarning.formattedElapsedTime.value"
      :estimated-duration="timeWarning.estimatedDuration.value"

content.text:
The issue has been fixed! Here's what I found and corrected:

## Problem Analysis
The real-time dot color updates weren't working because:
1. âœ… **Upload start**: The "uploading" status was showing â³ instead of ðŸŸ¡ (yellow dot)
2. âœ… **Upload success**: Already correctly showing ðŸŸ¢ (green dot) for 'completed' status  
3. âœ… **Upload failure**: Already correctly showing ðŸ”´ (red dot) for 'error' status

## Solution Applied
**Fixed the uploading status icon** in `LazyFileItem.vue:95` by changing the emoji from â³ to ðŸŸ¡.

The status updates are already properly implemented in the upload flow:
- **File starts uploading**: `updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'uploading')` â†’ now shows ðŸŸ¡
- **Upload succeeds**: `updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'completed')` â†’ shows ðŸŸ¢  
- **Upload fails**: `updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'error')` â†’ shows ðŸ”´

The real-time updates should now work correctly during your next file upload test.

Also, when files are skipped due to already existing in the firebase storage, the files should be updated to an orange dot ðŸŸ .\
At the same time that we are skipping a file, we should record an upload event for each skipped file.  When skipping files, we should also record metadata for that file, using metadata hash method for constraint based deduplication of metadata records.  This metadata hash method of constraint based deduplication should be documented in docs\data-structures.md.  It it is not, let me know.

content.content:
1â†’# Firestore Data Structure Design (KISS Edition)
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’This document defines a **simple, scalable** Firestore data structure for our multi-tenant team-based architecture supporting Multi-App SSO. Following the KISS principle, we've eliminated unnecessary complexity while maintaining all essential functionality.
     6â†’
     7â†’**Key Design Decisions:**
     8â†’- Teams typically have 3-10 members (max 100)
     9â†’- All apps share the same role-based permissions
    10â†’- No denormalization needed for queries
    11â†’- No audit trails in MVP
    12â†’- Flat structure for simplicity
    13â†’
    14â†’## Core Data Structure
    15â†’
    16â†’### 1. Users Collection: `/users/{userId}`
    17â†’**Purpose**: Store user preferences and app-specific settings
    18â†’
    19â†’```javascript
    20â†’{
    21â†’  // User preferences only (identity comes from Firebase Auth)
    22â†’  defaultTeamId: 'team-abc-123',  // Primary team for quick access (could be userId for solo users)
    23â†’  preferences: {
    24â†’    theme: 'light',
    25â†’    notifications: true,
    26â†’    language: 'en'
    27â†’  },
    28â†’  
    29â†’  // Activity tracking
    30â†’  createdAt: Timestamp,
    31â†’  lastLogin: Timestamp
    32â†’}
    33â†’```
    34â†’
    35â†’### 2. Teams Collection: `/teams/{teamId}`
    36â†’**Purpose**: Store team info and embedded member list
    37â†’
    38â†’**Solo User Design**: New users automatically get a team where `teamId === userId`, making them a "team of one". This eliminates special cases in storage, security, and duplicate detection.
    39â†’
    40â†’```javascript
    41â†’{
    42â†’  // Team information
    43â†’  name: 'ACME Law Firm',  // For solo users: "John's Workspace"
    44â†’  description: 'Full-service law firm',  // For solo users: "Personal workspace"
    45â†’  
    46â†’  // Embedded members (perfect for 3-10 users, or 1 for solo users)
    47â†’  members: {
    48â†’    'user-john-123': {
    49â†’      email: 'john@acme.com',
    50â†’      role: 'admin',  // 'admin' | 'member' (solo users are always admin)
    51â†’      joinedAt: Timestamp
    52â†’    },
    53â†’    'user-jane-456': {
    54â†’      email: 'jane@acme.com',
    55â†’      role: 'member',
    56â†’      joinedAt: Timestamp
    57â†’    }
    58â†’  },
    59â†’  
    60â†’  // Simple pending invitations
    61â†’  pendingInvites: {
    62â†’    'newuser@acme.com': {
    63â†’      invitedBy: 'user-john-123',
    64â†’      invitedAt: Timestamp,
    65â†’      role: 'member',
    66â†’      fromTeam: 'team-abc-123'  // Track which team invited them
    67â†’    }
    68â†’  },
    69â†’  
    70â†’  // Which apps this team has access to
    71â†’  apps: ['intranet', 'bookkeeper'],  // Simple array
    72â†’  
    73â†’  // Basic settings
    74â†’  settings: {
    75â†’    timezone: 'America/New_York',
    76â†’    maxMembers: 100
    77â†’  },
    78â†’  
    79â†’  // Team type flags
    80â†’  isPersonal: false,  // true for solo users (teamId === userId)
    81â†’  
    82â†’  // Metadata
    83â†’  createdAt: Timestamp,
    84â†’  createdBy: 'user-john-123'
    85â†’}
    86â†’```
    87â†’
    88â†’### 3. Team Data Collections: `/teams/{teamId}/{collection}/{documentId}`
    89â†’**Purpose**: All team data lives in flat collections under the team
    90â†’
    91â†’#### Clients Collection: `/teams/{teamId}/clients/{clientId}`
    92â†’```javascript
    93â†’{
    94â†’  name: 'ABC Corporation',
    95â†’  email: 'contact@abc.com',
    96â†’  phone: '+1-555-0123',
    97â†’  address: {
    98â†’    street: '123 Business Ave',
    99â†’    city: 'New York',
   100â†’    state: 'NY',
   101â†’    zip: '10001'
   102â†’  },
   103â†’  status: 'active',  // 'active' | 'inactive'
   104â†’  createdAt: Timestamp,
   105â†’  createdBy: 'user-john-123'
   106â†’}
   107â†’```
   108â†’
   109â†’#### Matters Collection: `/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}`
   110â†’
   111â†’**Reserved Matter ID**: Every team has a reserved `matterId` called **"general"** where the firm stores general information about the firm, company policies, and non-client-specific documents.
   112â†’
   113â†’```javascript
   114â†’{
   115â†’  title: 'ABC Corp - Contract Review',
   116â†’  description: 'Software licensing agreement review',
   117â†’  clientId: 'client-abc-123',  // Reference to client (null for 'general' matter)
   118â†’  matterNumber: '2024-001',
   119â†’  status: 'active',  // 'active' | 'closed' | 'on-hold'
   120â†’  priority: 'high',  // 'high' | 'medium' | 'low'
   121â†’  assignedTo: ['user-john-123', 'user-jane-456'],
   122â†’  openedDate: Timestamp,
   123â†’  dueDate: Timestamp,
   124â†’  createdAt: Timestamp,
   125â†’  createdBy: 'user-john-123'
   126â†’}
   127â†’```
   128â†’
   129â†’#### File Upload Logs: `/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}/logs/{documentId}`
   130â†’**Purpose**: Track file upload events chronologically as distinct records
   131â†’
   132â†’```javascript
   133â†’{
   134â†’  uploadedAt: Timestamp,
   135â†’  uploadedBy: 'user-john-123',
   136â†’  sessionId: 'session_uuid_abc123',  // Groups files uploaded in same batch
   137â†’  filesProcessed: 45,
   138â†’  duplicatesSkipped: 12,
   139â†’  totalSizeMB: 127.8,
   140â†’  uploadDurationMs: 45230,
   141â†’  hardwareCalibration: 1.85,  // H-factor for performance tracking
   142â†’  createdAt: Timestamp
   143â†’}
   144â†’```
   145â†’
   146â†’#### File Metadata Records: `/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}/metadata/{metadataHash}`
   147â†’**Purpose**: Store unique combinations of file metadata using metadata hash as document ID
   148â†’
   149â†’**Hash Generation**: 
   150â†’- **File Hash**: SHA-256 of file content (`abc123def456789abcdef012345...`)
   151â†’- **Metadata Hash**: SHA-256 of concatenated string: `originalName|lastModified|fileHash`
   152â†’
   153â†’```javascript
   154â†’{
   155â†’  // Core metadata (only what varies between identical files)
   156â†’  originalName: 'document.pdf',
   157â†’  lastModified: 1703123456789,  // File's original timestamp
   158â†’  fileHash: 'abc123def456789abcdef012345...',  // Standard SHA-256 reference to actual file content
   159â†’  
   160â†’  // Upload context
   161â†’  uploadedAt: Timestamp,
   162â†’  uploadedBy: 'user-john-123',
   163â†’  sessionId: 'session_uuid_abc123',
   164â†’  
   165â†’  // Computed fields for convenience
   166â†’  metadataHash: 'xyz789abc123',  // SHA-256 of concatenated metadata string
   167â†’  storagePath: '/teams/team-abc-123/matters/matter-001/files/abc123def456789abcdef012345.pdf',
   168â†’  
   169â†’  createdAt: Timestamp
   170â†’}
   171â†’```
   172â†’
   173â†’## Firebase Storage Structure
   174â†’
   175â†’### File Storage Paths
   176â†’**Purpose**: Store actual file content with automatic deduplication based on file hash
   177â†’
   178â†’```
   179â†’/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}/files/{fileHash}.{extension}
   180â†’```
   181â†’
   182â†’**Key Features**:
   183â†’- **Content Deduplication**: Identical files (same hash) stored only once
   184â†’- **Multi-Reference**: Single storage file can be referenced by multiple metadata records
   185â†’- **Matter-Scoped**: Files organized under specific matters for proper access control
   186â†’- **Extension Preservation**: Original file extensions maintained for proper file handling
   187â†’
   188â†’**Examples**:
   189â†’```
   190â†’/teams/team-abc-123/matters/general/files/abc123def456789abcdef012345.pdf
   191â†’/teams/team-abc-123/matters/matter-001/files/xyz789ghi012345fedcba678901.docx
   192â†’/teams/solo-user-789/matters/general/files/def456abc123789012345abcdef.jpg
   193â†’```
   194â†’
   195â†’**Storage Efficiency**:
   196â†’- Same file uploaded to multiple matters = single storage file + multiple metadata records
   197â†’- Same file with different original names = single storage file + multiple metadata records
   198â†’- Perfect deduplication while preserving all metadata variations
   199â†’
   200â†’## Custom Claims (Firebase Auth)
   201â†’
   202â†’Keep it **dead simple**. Solo users have `teamId === userId`:
   203â†’
   204â†’```javascript
   205â†’{
   206â†’  teamId: 'team-abc-123',  // For solo users: equals their userId
   207â†’  role: 'admin'            // Solo users are always 'admin', team members can be 'admin' | 'member'
   208â†’}
   209â†’```
   210â†’
   211â†’## Security Rules
   212â†’
   213â†’### Simple, Consistent Pattern
   214â†’
   215â†’```javascript
   216â†’rules_version = '2';
   217â†’service cloud.firestore {
   218â†’  match /databases/{database}/documents {
   219â†’    // Users can only access their own document
   220â†’    match /users/{userId} {
   221â†’      allow read, write: if request.auth != null && 
   222â†’                            request.auth.uid == userId;
   223â†’    }
   224â†’    
   225â†’    // Team members can read team, admins can write
   226â†’    match /teams/{teamId} {
   227â†’      allow read: if request.auth != null && 
   228â†’                     request.auth.token.teamId == teamId;
   229â†’      allow write: if request.auth != null && 
   230â†’                      request.auth.token.teamId == teamId &&
   231â†’                      request.auth.token.role == 'admin';
   232â†’    }
   233â†’    
   234â†’    // All team data follows same pattern
   235â†’    match /teams/{teamId}/{collection}/{document} {
   236â†’      allow read: if request.auth != null && 
   237â†’                     request.auth.token.teamId == teamId;
   238â†’      allow write: if request.auth != null && 
   239â†’                      request.auth.token.teamId == teamId;
   240â†’    }
   241â†’  }
   242â†’}
   243â†’```
   244â†’
   245â†’## Common Query Patterns
   246â†’
   247â†’### Simple, Efficient Queries
   248â†’
   249â†’```javascript
   250â†’// Get user's team
   251â†’const team = await db.collection('teams').doc(auth.currentUser.teamId).get()
   252â†’
   253â†’// Get team members (already embedded)
   254â†’const members = team.data().members
   255â†’
   256â†’// Get all active clients
   257â†’const clients = await db
   258â†’  .collection('teams').doc(teamId)
   259â†’  .collection('clients')
   260â†’  .where('status', '==', 'active')
   261â†’  .orderBy('name')
   262â†’  .get()
   263â†’
   264â†’// Get matters for a client
   265â†’const matters = await db
   266â†’  .collection('teams').doc(teamId)
   267â†’  .collection('matters')
   268â†’  .where('clientId', '==', clientId)
   269â†’  .where('status', '==', 'active')
   270â†’  .get()
   271â†’
   272â†’## Solo User to Team Workflow
   273â†’
   274â†’### New User Registration
   275â†’```javascript
   276â†’async function createNewUser(userId, email, displayName) {
   277â†’  // 1. Set custom claims (solo user is their own team)
   278â†’  await setCustomClaims(userId, {
   279â†’    teamId: userId,  // teamId === userId for solo users
   280â†’    role: 'admin'    // Solo users are admin of their own team
   281â†’  })
   282â†’  
   283â†’  // 2. Create user document
   284â†’  await db.collection('users').doc(userId).set({
   285â†’    defaultTeamId: userId,
   286â†’    preferences: { theme: 'light', notifications: true },
   287â†’    createdAt: new Date(),
   288â†’    lastLogin: new Date()
   289â†’  })
   290â†’  
   291â†’  // 3. Create solo team
   292â†’  await db.collection('teams').doc(userId).set({
   293â†’    name: `${displayName}'s Workspace`,
   294â†’    description: 'Personal workspace',
   295â†’    members: {
   296â†’      [userId]: {
   297â†’        email: email,
   298â†’        role: 'admin',
   299â†’        joinedAt: new Date()
   300â†’      }
   301â†’    },
   302â†’    pendingInvites: {},
   303â†’    apps: ['intranet', 'bookkeeper'],
   304â†’    settings: { timezone: 'UTC', maxMembers: 100 },
   305â†’    isPersonal: true,  // Flag for solo teams
   306â†’    createdAt: new Date(),
   307â†’    createdBy: userId
   308â†’  })
   309â†’}
   310â†’```
   311â†’
   312â†’## Handling Team Invitations and Mergers
   313â†’
   314â†’### Invitation Process
   315â†’1. **Admin adds email to `pendingInvites`** in team document
   316â†’2. **User signs up** with that email (creates solo team)
   317â†’3. **On login**, check all teams for pending invites
   318â†’4. **User accepts** â†’ migrate solo team data or merge teams
   319â†’
   320â†’### Team Migration Logic
   321â†’
   322â†’```javascript
   323â†’// Check for pending invitations on login
   324â†’async function checkAndProcessInvitations(userId, userEmail) {
   325â†’  const teamsSnapshot = await db.collection('teams')
   326â†’    .where(`pendingInvites.${userEmail}`, '!=', null)
   327â†’    .get()
   328â†’
   329â†’  if (!teamsSnapshot.empty) {
   330â†’    const invitingTeam = teamsSnapshot.docs[0]
   331â†’    const invite = invitingTeam.data().pendingInvites[userEmail]
   332â†’    
   333â†’    // Get user's current team (their solo team)
   334â†’    const currentTeam = await db.collection('teams').doc(userId).get()
   335â†’    const currentTeamData = currentTeam.data()
   336â†’    
   337â†’    if (currentTeamData.isPersonal && Object.keys(currentTeamData.members).length === 1) {
   338â†’      // Solo user joining another team - migrate data
   339â†’      await migrateSoloUserToTeam(userId, invitingTeam.id, invite.role)
   340â†’    } else {
   341â†’      // Team founder with members - team merger scenario
   342â†’      await promptForTeamMerger(userId, invitingTeam.id, invite)
   343â†’    }
   344â†’  }
   345â†’}
   346â†’
   347â†’async function migrateSoloUserToTeam(userId, newTeamId, role) {
   348â†’  // 1. Update custom claims
   349â†’  await setCustomClaims(userId, {
   350â†’    teamId: newTeamId,
   351â†’    role: role
   352â†’  })
   353â†’  
   354â†’  // 2. Add user to new team
   355â†’  await db.collection('teams').doc(newTeamId).update({
   356â†’    [`members.${userId}`]: {
   357â†’      email: auth.currentUser.email,
   358â†’      role: role,
   359â†’      joinedAt: new Date()
   360â†’    },
   361â†’    [`pendingInvites.${auth.currentUser.email}`]: firebase.firestore.FieldValue.delete()
   362â†’  })
   363â†’  
   364â†’  // 3. Migrate data from solo team to new team
   365â†’  await migrateTeamData(userId, newTeamId)
   366â†’  
   367â†’  // 4. Clean up solo team
   368â†’  await db.collection('teams').doc(userId).delete()
   369â†’}
   370â†’
   371â†’async function migrateTeamData(fromTeamId, toTeamId) {
   372â†’  // Migrate all subcollections: clients, matters, logs, metadata, etc.
   373â†’  const collections = ['clients', 'matters', 'logs', 'metadata']
   374â†’  
   375â†’  for (const collectionName of collections) {
   376â†’    const docs = await db
   377â†’      .collection('teams').doc(fromTeamId)
   378â†’      .collection(collectionName)
   379â†’      .get()
   380â†’    
   381â†’    // Copy documents to new team
   382â†’    const batch = db.batch()
   383â†’    docs.forEach(doc => {
   384â†’      const newDocRef = db
   385â†’        .collection('teams').doc(toTeamId)
   386â†’        .collection(collectionName).doc(doc.id)
   387â†’      batch.set(newDocRef, {
   388â†’        ...doc.data(),
   389â†’        migratedFrom: fromTeamId,
   390â†’        migratedAt: new Date()
   391â†’      })
   392â†’    })
   393â†’    await batch.commit()
   394â†’  }
   395â†’  
   396â†’  // Note: Firebase Storage files don't need to move - 
   397â†’  // we'll update storage paths in future uploads
   398â†’  // or create a background job for this
   399â†’}
   400â†’```
   401â†’
   402â†’## Required Firestore Indexes
   403â†’
   404â†’Keep indexes minimal:
   405â†’
   406â†’```javascript
   407â†’// Just the basics needed for common queries
   408â†’[
   409â†’  {
   410â†’    collection: 'teams/{teamId}/matters',
   411â†’    fields: [
   412â†’      { field: 'clientId', order: 'ASCENDING' },
   413â†’      { field: 'status', order: 'ASCENDING' }
   414â†’    ]
   415â†’  },
   416â†’  {
   417â†’    collection: 'teams/{teamId}/invoices',
   418â†’    fields: [
   419â†’      { field: 'clientId', order: 'ASCENDING' },
   420â†’      { field: 'createdAt', order: 'DESCENDING' }
   421â†’    ]
   422â†’  },
   423â†’  {
   424â†’    collection: 'teams/{teamId}/time-entries',
   425â†’    fields: [
   426â†’      { field: 'invoiceId', order: 'ASCENDING' },
   427â†’      { field: 'billable', order: 'ASCENDING' }
   428â†’    ]
   429â†’  }
   430â†’]
   431â†’```
   432â†’
   433â†’## Future Considerations (Only If Needed)
   434â†’
   435â†’**Don't add these until you actually need them:**
   436â†’
   437â†’1. **If teams grow beyond 100 members**: Move members to subcollection
   438â†’2. **If you need audit trails**: Add `history` array to documents
   439â†’3. **If you need per-app permissions**: Extend custom claims
   440â†’4. **If queries get complex**: Add specific denormalization
   441â†’
   442â†’Remember: **You can always add complexity later**. Keep it simple and add complexity only if the need arises based on real usage patterns.

1â†’import { ref } from 'vue'

     4â†’import { useAuthStore } from '../stores/auth.js'
     5â†’
     6â†’export function useUploadLogger() {
     7â†’  const authStore = useAuthStore()
     8â†’  
     9â†’  // Current upload session tracking
    10â†’  const currentSessionId = ref(null)
    11â†’  const sessionStartTime = ref(null)
    12â†’  
    13â†’  /**
    14â†’   * Generate a unique session ID for grouping upload events
    15â†’   */
    16â†’  const generateSessionId = () => {
    17â†’    return `session_${Date.now()}_${crypto.randomUUID()}`
    18â†’  }
    19â†’  
    20â†’  /**
    21â†’   * Start a new upload session
    22â†’   * @param {number} totalFiles - Total number of files in this upload batch
    23â†’   * @returns {string} sessionId - The generated session ID
    24â†’   */
    25â†’  const startUploadSession = async (totalFiles) => {
    26â†’    try {
    27â†’      currentSessionId.value = generateSessionId()
    28â†’      sessionStartTime.value = Date.now()
    29â†’      
    30â†’      console.log(`Started upload session: ${currentSessionId.value} with ${totalFiles} files`)
    31â†’      
    32â†’      return currentSessionId.value
    33â†’    } catch (error) {
    34â†’      console.error('Failed to start upload session:', error)
    35â†’      throw error
    36â†’    }
    37â†’  }
    38â†’  
    39â†’  /**
    40â†’   * Log the completion of an upload session
    41â†’   * @param {Object} stats - Upload statistics
    42â†’   * @param {number} stats.filesProcessed - Total files processed
    43â†’   * @param {number} stats.successful - Successfully uploaded files
    44â†’   * @param {number} stats.failed - Failed uploads
    45â†’   * @param {number} stats.duplicatesSkipped - Files skipped as duplicates
    46â†’   * @param {number} stats.totalSizeMB - Total size of all files in MB
    47â†’   */
    48â†’  const logUploadSession = async (stats) => {
    49â†’    try {
    50â†’      if (!currentSessionId.value || !sessionStartTime.value) {
    51â†’        console.warn('No active upload session to log')
    52â†’        return null
    53â†’      }
    54â†’      
    55â†’      const uploadDurationMs = Date.now() - sessionStartTime.value
    56â†’      const teamId = authStore.currentTeam
    57â†’      
    58â†’      if (!teamId) {
    59â†’        throw new Error('No team ID available for logging')
    60â†’      }
    61â†’      
    62â†’      // Create log entry in Firestore
    63â†’      const logData = {
    64â†’        uploadedAt: serverTimestamp(),
    65â†’        uploadedBy: authStore.user.uid,
    66â†’        sessionId: currentSessionId.value,
    67â†’        
    68â†’        // Upload statistics
    69â†’        filesProcessed: stats.filesProcessed || 0,
    70â†’        successful: stats.successful || 0,
    71â†’        failed: stats.failed || 0,
    72â†’        duplicatesSkipped: stats.duplicatesSkipped || 0,
    73â†’        
    74â†’        // Performance metrics
    75â†’        totalSizeMB: Math.round((stats.totalSizeMB || 0) * 10) / 10, // Round to 1 decimal
    76â†’        uploadDurationMs: uploadDurationMs,
    77â†’        
    78â†’        // Hardware calibration (if available from processing)
    79â†’        hardwareCalibration: stats.hardwareCalibration || null,
    80â†’        
    81â†’        createdAt: serverTimestamp()
    82â†’      }
    83â†’      
    84â†’      // Add to Firestore: /teams/{teamId}/matters/general/logs/{documentId}
    85â†’      const logsCollection = collection(db, 'teams', teamId, 'matters', 'general', 'logs')
    86â†’      const docRef = await addDoc(logsCollection, logData)
    87â†’      
    88â†’      console.log(`Upload session logged: ${docRef.id}`, {
    89â†’        sessionId: currentSessionId.value,
    90â†’        duration: `${uploadDurationMs}ms`,
    91â†’        stats: stats
    92â†’      })
    93â†’      
    94â†’      // Reset session tracking
    95â†’      currentSessionId.value = null
    96â†’      sessionStartTime.value = null
    97â†’      
    98â†’      return docRef.id
    99â†’    } catch (error) {
   100â†’      console.error('Failed to log upload session:', error)
   101â†’      throw error
   102â†’    }
   103â†’  }
   104â†’  
   105â†’  /**
   106â†’   * Get the current session ID (useful for metadata records)
   107â†’   */
   108â†’  const getCurrentSessionId = () => {
   109â†’    return currentSessionId.value
   110â†’  }
   111â†’  
   112â†’  /**
   113â†’   * Get session duration in milliseconds
   114â†’   */
   115â†’  const getSessionDuration = () => {
   116â†’    if (!sessionStartTime.value) return 0
   117â†’    return Date.now() - sessionStartTime.value
   118â†’  }
   119â†’  
   120â†’  return {
   121â†’    // Session management
   122â†’    startUploadSession,
   123â†’    logUploadSession,
   124â†’    getCurrentSessionId,
   125â†’    getSessionDuration,
   126â†’    
   127â†’    // Reactive session state
   128â†’    currentSessionId,
   129â†’    sessionStartTime
   130â†’  }
   131â†’}

content.text:
Based on my analysis, I need to add individual upload event logging for skipped files. The current implementation only logs session-level statistics, but the user wants individual upload events for each skipped file.

Let me first check if there are any individual upload event logging functions, and if not, I'll need to add them:

content.content: No files found
